text: this is Suzy Menkes in London at
Somerset House the heritage building
that is the home to the celebration of
25 years of London fashion
UK maybe in full-on recession but you'd
never think so looking at the dynamic
energetic and colourful clothes in
London Fashion Week perhaps the thing
that's changed most of our London in
these 25 years is the diversity of the
city London is really the New York of
Europe so many people come here and it's
that special mix that brings the energy
to London
even beleaguered Prime Minister Gordon
Brown managed a smile when his wife gave
a party for the designers at number 10
Downing Street the official residence
where mr. Brown even got a chance to
have his tie straightened by designer
Ozwald Boateng laid out in Downing
Street were photographs of the history
of these 25 years taken by photographer
Christopher Moore his pictures tell the
story British fashion has always been
about two things heritage and rebellion
when Margaret Thatcher was in power in
the early 1980s that's when punk came up
as our rejection of the capitalist
attitude there's a lot of that around
still but there's heritage too and you
couldn't get more so than at Somerset
House the new venue in the heart of
London and the aim is to make people
feel that London is the hub a real
centerpiece of fashions
for the New York Times and the
International Herald Tribune this is
Suzy Menkes celebrating 25 years of
London Fashion Week
you
